title: How to Make Fried Bean Curd

steps.headline: Prepare the bean curd.
steps.description: Drain the bean curd pieces and sit in a wire strainer.

steps.headline: Pour the oil into the wok or deep pan or pot.
Heat until the oil is almost smoking.
Lower a few pieces at a time into the hot oil.
steps.description: Use tongs or a slotted spoon to hold and place the bean curd pieces in. Do this very carefully, as spattering oil can burn skin.

steps.headline: Cook quickly.
steps.description: When the bean curd pieces turns a light golden color, remove using the tongs or slotted spoon.

steps.headline: Place the fried pieces of bean curd on a plate lined with absorbent paper.
steps.description: Sprinkle with soy sauce and the salt and pepper mixture.

steps.headline: Serve immediately.
steps.description: It can be served with stir-fried Chinese greens for a meal, by itself for a snack, on a warming plate for a buffet or as a small meal for children. It can also be chilled.
